summary:
I'm a neuroscientist with a strong background in data science and analysis, and an ever-growing interest in open-source science, sustainability and circular economy. I currently work at TNO as a scientist on microplastic-mitigation projects, aiming to understand how microplastics are released into air and water, and what we can do about it. 

Previously, I founded and directed the Cajal training course on Extracellular Electrophysiology, which focuses on the electronics and theory behind data acquisition tools.

I'm currently focusing on microplastics release and mitigation, primarily as data scientist and project lead.", 'title': 'Microplastics Scientist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 67233878, 'name': 'CAJAL Advanced Neuroscience Training Programme', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQExPs965YkhjA/company-logo_400_400/0/1596627373104?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=CK0wpozrwhV5hHI5s5zhTSR-Um8AUx_n91HU_3spZKA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/cajal-training/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'CAJAL Advanced Neuroscience Training Programme', 'description': "Extracellular electrophysiology is the measurement of cellular electrical signalling, performed with an electrode placed outside the cell. 
It is the most widely-used technique in Neuroscience, and yet, many electrophysiologists never develop a clear idea of how the acquisition system works. To counter this 'black box' approach, I developed a week-long, in-depth course on the electronics and theory behind data acquisition, covering:
- A basic electronics refresher
- The equivalent circuit of electrodes and neurons
- How amplifiers work, and how to build an instrumentation amplifier. 
- How to build your own acquisition system (a breadboard-based device that detects muscle contraction, and can be built at home with the kit contents and a laptop)", 'title': 'Course Founder and Director - Extracellular Electrophysiology Acquisition ', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 28598432, 'name': 'OEPS - Open Ephys Production Site', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEf2gaxmrYJGg/company-logo_400_400/0/1522623943934?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=PtXcuptmPmeHHANfEV_ne7kHtysXrYp91TocuZhCl9w', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/open-ephys-production-site/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Lisbon Area, Portugal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'OEPS - Open Ephys Production Site', 'description': 'Open Ephys Production Site designs, produces & supports high-quality, open-source tools for Neuroscience. OEPS operates on a not-for-profit model, only charging what is needed to keep the lights on and production rolling.

At OEPS, I :
- Managed the international support team, making sure customers could get support using a wide range of devices. 
- Developed and customized software to help labs acquire and analyse data (in Python and MATLAB)
- Built our documentation websites (HTML) 
- Developed, managed & taught on-site & remote installations and trainings for new users, aiming at really understanding the tool they will be using and how to make informed choices for their experiments. 
- Formed a communication bridge between device users (neuroscientists) and device developers (engineers)  
- Developed in-depth scientific content for our documentation, courses & training programmes', 'title': 'Science & Customer Success Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id':
